content.question:
Scientists conducted a transformation experiment using E. coli bacteria and the <math alttext="p T r u" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>u</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> plasmid. Samples of the <math alttext="p T r u" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>u</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> plasmid (lane <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) and the chromosomal <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> from two different E. coli strains that the scientists attempted to transform (lane <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and lane <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) were compared using gel electrophoresis. The results are shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Results of E. coli transformation with <math alttext="p T r u" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>u</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> plasmid

Which of the following statements best explains the experimental results observed in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: E. coli in both lanes <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have been successfully transformed and contain additional genetic information.
E. coli in lane <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have been successfully transformed and contain additional genetic information.
E. coli in lane <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have been successfully transformed and contain additional genetic information.
Which E. coli have been transformed cannot be determined from this gel.

content.answer: E. coli in lane <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have been successfully transformed and contain additional genetic information.

skill.text: 6.D: Explain the relationship between experimental results and larger biological concepts, processes, or theories.
